alert.note: Alert for Bandera; Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Gillespie; Kendall; Kerr; Kinney; Maverick; Medina; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 30 at 8:39PM CDT until March 31 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR PORTIONS OF THE HILL COUNTRY, SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS ON THURSDAY DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS... .A dry airmass following a pair of cold fronts results in humidity values to fall into the teens on Thursday. This low humidity combined with gusty northwest winds will result in critical fire weather conditions across portions of the Hill County, southern Edwards Plateau and the Rio Grande Plains Fuels remain extremely dry, and this is leading to an active season of wildfires that are difficult to contain. Any outdoor activity that could lead to the development of sparks and resulting wildfire potential is highly discouraged!. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM CDT ON THURSDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE HILL COUNTRY, SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU AND RIO GRANDE PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 6 PM CDT Thursday. * WINDS...Northwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks. Take care to stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
